reviewText:
If you enjoy Match 3 games, or just want a simple break from a sprawling epic, Castles is a nice change of pace! Its story mode may be on the short side (around 2-3 hours), but it provides good, hectic fun with another player! The co-op isn't perfect, but the competitive mode will surely provide some entertainment for a while (and perhaps ruin friendships).

In response to some negative reviews, I did not find any problems playing the game with the keyboard. If you don't like the original bindings, you can easily remap the keys. And for those curious, you do not need a controller for two players to play at once. Two people on a keyboard (one using W, A, S, D, and the other using arrow keys) worked just fine - it all just comes down to preference.

For more details and thoughts, you can read my full review here[moviepilot.com].

reviewText:
This game is not mouse enabled.  The tutorial does not work for keyboard uses.

I found gameplay tedious on the keyboard.  It may play just find on controller, but for keyboard users it quickly becomes tiresome.

Refunded.

I wouldn't recommend this game for keyboard users.

reviewText: Awesome puzle game, with fancy and colorful graphics, fun and addictive. It has a simple gameplay (match-3) but doesn't get boring with bosses every 10 levels that slightly changes the mechanics and multiple possible combinations (materials or the tools above the blocks). If the 50 level story mode isn't enough, there is a versus mode if you have a friend or brother/sister to play with, and a survival mode where you can try to break your records.\n\nFully recommended

reviewText:
A great idea, a horrible mistake that makes the game almost unplayable.

I bought this to play with my girlfriend, we tried, but the unresponsiveness of the controls is way too much, the first thing I noticed is the delay, you press a key and it takes some time for the game to make the movement, this is not really an issue (well, it is for some, but you get used to it), however, the word part is that the keys stop responding entirely, you press something and the game won't do anything about it so the game will turn into a try to get victory until the controls fail on you and make you lose".

The game would be nice
recommended: and we were looking forward to the fun this game could have
hoursPlayed: but when you can't even move some times it turns out really frustrating."
